name: Zucchini Salad
description: This exquisitely simple recipe from Jacques Pépin first appeared in The Times in 1991, and couldn't be easier. The zucchini is gently roasted until tender, then tossed with salt, pepper, white wine vinegar and oil. It's the perfect treatment for almost any summer squash.
keywords: dairy-free, gluten-free, nut-free, vegan, vegetarian, zucchini

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the zucchini, trim and discard the ends, and cut crosswise into 1/4-inch thick rounds. Arrange the rounds in one layer on a large cookie sheet and sprinkle them with the salt. Place in oven for 5 to 7 minutes, until they soften slightly.
Transfer the rounds to a bowl and toss them lightly with the pepper, vinegar and oil. Serve immediately.
